snippet.title: Nambour Crushers to reflect on grand final milestone
snippet.content:
RUGBY LEAGUE: Nambour will turn back the clock to celebrate a milestone as its A-grade side hits the field for its final home game of the season. As the Crushers battle against Caloundra in Sunshine Coast's division one, the club will celebrate the 30th anniversary of its first grand final win. Former players and members will reminisce as they watch the current outfit play on Saturday (4.30pm) at Crusher Park. "It'll be good if everyone can get out there and support the club and support the players that played 30 years ago in the first grand final," coach Ben Olsen said. "It should be a great day and night all round." It's been a tough season for the Crushers, which sits last on the six-team ladder through 17 of 19 rounds. Olsen said his side has been plagued with injuries and relied on reserve grade and U18 stocks to back-up and hit the field in A-grade most weekends. "If you turn up to Nambour you'll see people on crutches, in casts and a lot of major players have injured knees, ankles, hands, broken arms and all sorts of ligaments." Despite the run of bad luck, Olsen hoped Nambour could claim a win at home. "We're always hopeful and we're always out there 100 percent committed," he said. Ladder leader Maroochydore - which only needs to turn up to play its last two games to win the minor premiership - hosts Caboolture and Noosa hosts Kawana.
